intro: Octomeria irrorata, commonly known as the silverleaf octomeria, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its silvery-gray foliage, which gives it its common name. It produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Octomeria irrorata is often found in rocky or arid environments, adapting well to dry conditions.
